title: lr
text:
Quarto
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished presentation. To learn more about Quarto presentations see https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/.

title: lr
text:
Bullets
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes:

Content authored with markdown
Output from executable code

title: lr
text:
Code
When you click the Render button a presentation will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:


[1] 2

Plot (With Sliders) lr(700) viewof b = Inputs.range([-10, 120], {label: "Intercept", step: 0.1}) viewof w = Inputs.range([-5, 5], {label: "Slope", step: 0.1}) html`
y = ${w} · x + ${b}
` https://oduerr.github.io/anim/lr

title: Creating Components
text:
Solution all in ObservableHQ (not working) and only little adaptation Components like scatterplot are build in observablehq.com/@oduerr Adding Component Quarto Presentation import {plot, b, w} from "https://observablehq.com/@oduerr/lr" //import { plot as myplot} from "https://observablehq.com/@oduerr/lr" plot() b w Inputs.button([ ["Set to 0", () => set(viewof b, 0)], ["Set to 100", () => set(viewof b, 120)] ]) html`
y = ${w} · x + ${b}
`

title: Linear Regression

text:
{#Plot(with sliders) data-menu-title=“with sliders”} //Redoing the plot lr(700) viewof b = Inputs.range([-10, 120], {label: "Intercept", step: 0.1}) viewof w = Inputs.range([-5, 5], {label: "Slope", step: 0.1}) html`
y = ${w} · x + ${b}
` https://oduerr.github.io/anim/lr

title: Linear Regression
text:
//Redoing the plot lr(800) viewof b = Inputs.range([-10, 120], {label: "Intercept", step: 0.1}) viewof w = Inputs.range([-5, 5], {label: "Slope", step: 0.1}) html`
y = ${w} · x + ${b}
`
